title: Open Cosmos wins Greek government satellite contract
summary: European smallsat manufacturer Open Cosmos has won a contract to build a constellation of seven satellites for the Greek government.

title: Chang’e-6 set for weekend landing attempt as sun rises over Apollo crater
summary: Chang’e-6 is set to make its lunar landing attempt this weekend, in what will be a critical moment in China’s mission to collect the first samples from the far side of the moon.

title: SLIM Sleeps in this Month
summary: Japan’s Smart Lander for Investigating Moon did not wake up when JAXA sent a signal yesterday (EDT). The sturdy lander has surprised everyone by continuing to operate after repeated long, […]

title: Falcon 9 launches ESA’s EarthCARE mission
summary: A Falcon 9 successfully launched an Earth science mission for Europe and Japan May 28 as part of the European Space Agency’s ongoing, if temporary, reliance on SpaceX for space access.

title: ThinkOrbital developing satellite repair toolkit with X-ray vision
summary: The Colorado-based startup recently demonstrated autonomous in-space welding

title: SpaceX has launched the EarthCARE climate research satellite for ESA and JAXA
summary: The joint European-Japanese EarthCARE satellite has begun its mission to improve our understanding of Earth’s climate Tuesday, with a launch atop a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket. Liftoff from Space Launch Complex 4E (SLC-4E) at Vandenberg Space Force Base in California happened at 3:20 PM Pacific Time (22:20 UTC).

title: Japanese satellite order puts GEO market on par with 2023
summary: A communications satellite order from Japan’s flagship operator has brought the geostationary orbit market back to par with last year.

title: Rocket Lab launches first of back-to-back missions for NASA
summary: Rocket Lab launched the Ready, Aim, PREFIRE mission for NASA over the weekend from Launch Complex 1 on the Mahia Peninsula in...

title: Colossus processor gains flight heritage
summary: Space computing startup Colossus has gained flight heritage for Kestrel, a processor built to operate in orbit.

title: How privacy-preserving technology can advance satellite collision detection
summary: Since no one group controls space, the open sharing of space situational awareness (SSA) data is critical to ensure safe space operations.
